newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Senate passes Antarctica environmental bill.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Senate passes Antarctica environmental bill.

text.p: The U.S. Senate on Thursday passed a bill to make U.S. research activities in Antarctica consistent with an international treaty to protect the Antarctic environment.
The bill, which passed unanimously, would impose strict rules on incinerating or disposing of waste, and would continue the ban on exploration and development of Antarctic minerals.
The legislation would apply U.S. environmental provisions for assessing and monitoring human effects on the fragile Antarctic environment.
The bill would also keep the National Science Foundation as the lead agency responsible for managing the U.S. Antarctic science programme and issuing regulations and research permits.
The House of Representatives passed its legislation in April to implement environmental measures of the Antarctic treaty agreed to by 26 countries in 1991.
